attributes.action: United Kingdom to Investigate the Police Shootings in America.
attributes.additional_details:
Nearly 1 in 3 black people killed by US police in 2015 were identified as unarmed.
U.S. police have killed at least 194 black people in 2016, according to a project by The Guardian in the US.
Afro/Caribbean American people believe they are being murdered and have no one to turn to for help outside of America.
United Kingdom have the best, Organised Policing System in the world. Training can be shared with United States Police Force for a better relationship and end the death toll rising.
attributes.background:
Aim: United Kingdom need to intervene and investigate why police in America are shooting unarmed People of dark skin (black).
Our Government has the Skills,Intelligence,and knowledge to intervene,defuse,train or convict, under the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, Article 3,5,27*.

rejection.details:
The UK Government isn't responsible for investigating the police in other countries.

You could start a new petition calling on the UK Government to offer support and training to the police in the USA.
